message.content:
To add a theme switcher that toggles between light and dark themes using JavaScript, you can follow these steps. You'll need to modify your `index.html` file by adding a button for switching themes and including some JavaScript to handle the theme change. Here's how you can do it: 1. **Add a Button**: Insert a button element in your HTML that will serve as the theme switcher. 2. **JavaScript Logic**: Add a script section to toggle between light and dark themes when this button is clicked. Below is an example of what your updated `index.html` might look like: ```html Austin183's Blog Posts

Midiestro Posts

These posts go into more detail about particular commits to the Midestro project. Mainly why I thought I needed to make them and how I came to the implementation.

  • The Beginning (October 23, 2024) - TL;DR - Made a page that wasn't very good at being a game yet. Took notes about what to do better for the next several iterations.
  • Iterating Towards Playability (October 24, 2024) - TL;DR - Added more debugging and worked on UI / UX concerns with selecting notes to play and seeing them at the right places on the canvas.
  • Adding Interactivity (October 25, 2024) - TL;DR - Added some game options and better visual feedback for scoring points during the game.
  • Getting to Feature Complete (October 26, 2024) - TL;DR - Added a scoreboard, fixed bugs, and got to Feature Complete!
  • Modest Optimizations (October 28, 2024) - TL;DR - Trimmed down on loops and iterations in loops while the game interval ran.
  • Effective Optimizations (October 29, 2024) - TL;DR - Added Precached rendered notes and measured performance with browser developer tools.
  • Unit Testing and Software Development with Llama 3.3 70b (November 23, 2024) - TL;DR - Wrote Unit Tests and rewrote complex method that had bugs in it.
``` ### Explanation: - **Initial Theme Setting**: The `body` element starts with a class of `light-theme`. This sets the initial theme when the page loads. - **Theme Switcher Button**: A button with an ID `theme-switcher` is added. It serves as the trigger for switching themes. - **JavaScript Logic**: A script at the end of the body listens for clicks on this button: - The script checks if the `body` element has a class of `light-theme`. If it does, it removes that class and adds `dark-theme`. - If not, it switches back by removing `dark-theme` and adding `light-theme`. This setup allows users to toggle between light and dark themes dynamically.
